results.title: Side show
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Features Marcel Marceau in a pantomine of circus performers demonstrating their skills: a juggler, an acrobat, clowns pulling ropes, and a tightrope walker. From the series “The Art of silence”.

results.title: The Mole and the bulldozer
results.brief_description: An animated film about a mole tending his flowerbeds only to find surveyors stakes marking a projected road. When he sees a bulldozer approaching, the mole quickly devises a plan to outwit the bulldozer and save his garden.

results.title: Kick me
results.brief_description: Amusing animated cartoon drawn directly onto the frames of 35mm motion picture film. An action filled story involving a pair of legs, a baseball and a gang of spiders.

results.title: Le Pink grapefruit
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Halprin, Sue Yung Li Ikeda, Phoenix Films and Roadhouse Productions
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of the Spanish artist Salvador Dali. Shows how his surrealism is carried over into his home and lifestyle. Includes a tour of the Salvador Dali Museum in Figeras, Spain, in which the artist discusses the building and the collection. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Master weavers of the Andes
results.brief_description: Examines the craft of weaving as practised by the Quechua Indians near Cuzco, Peru. Points out that except for the use of chemical dyes, the processes of spinning and weaving are practised as they have been for centuries. Camera and editing Peter Pilafian. Narrated by David Ossman.
results.description: Examines the craft of weaving as practised by the Quechua Indians near Cuzco, Peru. results.title: African carving: a Dogon Kanaga mask
results.brief_description: Examines the ceremonies and rituals surrounding the Kanaga mask. Shows the ritual of carving the mask and presents part of the ceremony in which the mask is used to release the spirit of a dead man.
results.description: Examines the ceremonies and rituals surrounding the Kanaga mask. Shows the ritual of carving the mask and presents part of the ceremony in which the mask is used to release the spirit of a dead man.

results.title: Strega Nonna
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Animated version of a traditional Calabrian tale retold and illustrated by Tomi de Paola. The story tells about a wise witch and her magic pasta pot. Winner of numerous awards. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: It's easy to criticize
results.brief_description: Deals with the isolation many migrants feel when they are unable to communicate their difficulties and problems to Australians, especially those in authority. To help with these problems they have established their own clubs, where they can share their own language. Recently the New South Wales Government has established the Ethnic Affairs Commission to deal with migrant affairs and welfare.

results.title: For Better - For Worse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Dramatization of common misconceptions surrounding marriage and the types of stress contributing to marriage breakdown. Refers to alcohol, the consequences of “mateship” and violence.
